sen.e: When libraries were established in the Meiji period, shiryo soshikiron (organization theory of documents) and tosho bunruiho (book classification method) were introduced as a technique of toshokangaku (library science) to make tosho mokuroku.

When libraries were established in the Meiji Period, shiryo soshikiron (principles regarding the organization of documents) and tosho bunruiho (book classification method) were introduced as techniques of toshokangaku (library science) to make tosho mokuroku.

When libraries were established in the Meiji Period, the principle of library material organization and the method of book classification were introduced as techniques of library science to make tosho mokuroku (library catalogue).
